Success 200.description: Unique alert identifier
A party(or source or authority etc) issuing alert(or warning or notification).
Denoting type of the subject of the alert.
Denoting message of the alert.
Delineation of area(s) that may be affected by the alert.
Additional file with supplemental information related to alert message e.g. an image or audio file.
Date and time the alert was issued(or generated) by the alert source(or generator) e.g 2018-07-28 23:53:19 etc.
The expected time of the beginning of the subject event of the alert message e.g 2018-02-01T16:49:00
The expiry time of the information of the alert message e.g 2018-03-03T11:19:00
The effective time of the information of the alert message e.g e.g 2018-02-01T15:19:00
The effective date and time when alert occurance ended e.g 2018-02-01T15:19:00
Human readable direction(received or given) of the alert i.e Inbound or Outbound.
Date when alert was created.
Date when alert was last updated.

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
{
   _id: "5bb25b91265be953c92f1521",
   source:
   {
       name: "Nicolas - Gulgowski",
       phone: "509.465.8501",
       email: "phoebe_borer26@yahoo.com",
       website: "https://waylon.com"
   },
   event:
   {
       code: "de2ed472-b3c5-44da-902d-51e96fc6e7ad",
       name: "Sit sit nisi earum maiores commodi voluptatum illum.",
       category: "Safety",
       description: "Et et doloremque iusto nihil eos nam in consequatur.",
       urgency: "Past",
       severity: "Moderate",
       certainty: "Unlikely",
       response: "Shelter"
   },
   message:
   {
       status: "System",
       type: "Ask",
       scope: "Restricted",
       restriction: "Necessitatibus est quod.",
       addresses: ["mervin16@yahoo.com"],
       code: "azure",
       note: "Pariatur repellat dignissimos quas.",
       headline: "Ipsa animi impedit officia.",
       instruction: "Perspiciatis repudiandae doloribus.",
       website: "http://ashly.net"
   },
   area:
   {
       description: "Borders",
       geometry:
       {
           type: "Polygon",
           coordinates: [
               [
                   [44.184551651362, -1.6081961004244478],
                   [41.21125601611241, -8.010221783743527],
                   [37.854639889998076, -7.8464285284416935],
                   [36.51791603953068, -11.054968936423933],
                   [33.01453708697774, -15.497233831943916],
                   [32.784868513491695, -13.29610438543305],
                   [35.67894312439057, -7.63634997688592],
                   [30.492728316323237, -8.692066624888076],
                   [31.689532286539443, -2.864154032119321],
                   [37.13965577600533, -5.922104559306792],
                   [44.184551651362, -1.6081961004244478]
               ]
           ]
       },
       altitude: 3263313890770944,
       ceiling: 2341686824927232
   },
   resources: [

Success 200.description: List of alerts
Unique alert identifier
A party(or source or authority etc) issuing alert(or warning or notification).
Denoting type of the subject of the alert.
Denoting message of the alert.
Delineation of area(s) that may be affected by the alert.
Additional file with supplemental information related to alert message e.g. an image or audio file.
Date and time the alert was issued(or generated) by the alert source(or generator) e.g 2018-07-28 23:53:19 etc.
The expected time of the beginning of the subject event of the alert message e.g 2018-02-01T16:49:00
The expiry time of the information of the alert message e.g 2018-03-03T11:19:00
The effective time of the information of the alert message e.g e.g 2018-02-01T15:19:00
The effective date and time when alert occurance ended e.g 2018-02-01T15:19:00
Human readable direction(received or given) of the alert i.e Inbound or Outbound.
Date when alert was created.
Date when alert was last updated.
Total number of alert
Number of alert returned
Query limit used
Query skip/offset used
Page number
Total number of pages
Date and time at which latest alert was last modified

description: Human readable, system specific code identifying the event type(incident type) of the alert e.g 2018090001, 20180001 etc.
